articles.content:
Indonesian embassy officials help Korean farmers 
    Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- Ambassador Buchari Effendi and officials of the Indonesian embassy here yesterday helped the farmers of the Korea-Indonesia Friendship Yaksu co-op Farm in weeding in a maize field.
 During a break they enjoyed entertainment with farmers and talked to each other, deepening the feelings of friendship.    
 The Indonesian guests handed their aid materials to the farm.

articles.content:
Sinchon Museum visited by military attaches corps 
    Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- The military attaches corps here visited the Sinchon Museum yesterday on the occasion of the "June 25, day of struggle against U.S. imperialists."
 The museum situated in Sinchon county, South Hwanghae Province, bears witness to U.S. imperialist aggression troops' brutal mass killings of 35,000 guiltless civilians of the county or a quarter of its population during the last Korean War.    
 Members of the corps went round exhibits at the museum and the anti-air raid shelter of the then Sinchon county party committee, the powder store in Wonam-ri, graves of 5,605 patriots, 400 mothers and 102 childrens, all killed by yankees, and so on.

Rodong Sinmun on national self-respect
articles.content:
Yugoslav embassy officials help Korean farmers 
    Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- Ambassador Milorad Kosovac and officials of the Yugoslav embassy here helped members of the DPRK-Yugoslavia Friendship Myongsok co-op Farm in Sinchon county, south hwanghae province, yesterday in rice transplanting.
 They enjoyed an art performance given by children, deepening the friendly feelings.    
 That day the Yugoslav guests delivered their aid materials to the farm.
